member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.AddIVSCResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Adds or updates tags for the AWS resource with the specified ARN.

para.para: The ARN of the resource to be tagged. The ARN must be URL-encoded.

Array of tags to be added or updated. See Tagging AWS Resources for details, including restrictions that apply to tags and "Tag naming limits and requirements"; Amazon IVS Chat has no constraints beyond what is documented there.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.AddIVSCResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Ivschat.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.AddIVSCResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.AddIVSCResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.DisconnectIVSCUserCmdlet
member.summary: Disconnects all connections using a specified user ID from a room. This replicates the DisconnectUser WebSocket operation in the Amazon IVS Chat Messaging API.

para.para: Reason for disconnecting the user.
Identifier of the room from which the user's clients should be disconnected. Currently this must be an ARN.
ID of the user (connection) to disconnect from the room.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.DisconnectIVSCUserCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Ivschat.Model.DisconnectUserResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.DisconnectIVSCUserCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the RoomIdentifier parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^RoomIdentifier' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.DisconnectIVSCUserCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.GetIVSCResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Gets information about AWS tags for the specified ARN.

para.para: The ARN of the resource to be retrieved. The ARN must be URL-encoded.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.GetIVSCResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Tags'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Ivschat.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Ivschat.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.GetIVSCResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.GetIVSCRoomCmdlet
member.summary: Gets the specified room.

para.para: Identifier of the room for which the configuration is to be retrieved. Currently this must be an ARN.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.GetIVSCRoomCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Ivschat.Model.GetRoomResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Ivschat.Model.GetRoomResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.GetIVSCRoomCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Identifier parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Identifier' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.GetIVSCRoomListCmdlet
member.summary: Gets summary information about all your rooms in the AWS region where the API request is processed. Results are sorted in descending order of updateTime.

para.para: Filters the list to match the specified message review handler URI.
Filters the list to match the specified room name.
Maximum number of rooms to return. Default: 50.
The first room to retrieve. This is used for pagination; see the nextToken response field.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.GetIVSCRoomListCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Rooms'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Ivschat.Model.ListRoomsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Ivschat.Model.ListRoomsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.GetIVSCRoomListCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.NewIVSCChatTokenCmdlet
member.summary:
Creates an encrypted token that is used to establish an individual WebSocket connection to a room. The token is valid for one minute, and a connection (session) established with the token is valid for the specified duration.
Encryption keys are owned by Amazon IVS Chat and never used directly by your application.

para.para: Application-provided attributes to encode into the token and attach to a chat session. Map keys and values can contain UTF-8 encoded text. The maximum length of this field is 1 KB total.
Set of capabilities that the user is allowed to perform in the room. Default: None (the capability to view messages is implicitly included in all requests).
Identifier of the room that the client is trying to access. Currently this must be an ARN.
Session duration (in minutes), after which the session expires. Default: 60 (1 hour).
Application-provided ID that uniquely identifies the user associated with this token. This can be any UTF-8 encoded text.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.NewIVSCChatTokenCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Ivschat.Model.CreateChatTokenResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Ivschat.Model.CreateChatTokenResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.NewIVSCChatTokenCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the RoomIdentifier parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^RoomIdentifier' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.NewIVSCChatTokenCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.NewIVSCRoomCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a room that allows clients to connect and pass messages.

para.para: Specifies the fallback behavior (whether the message is allowed or denied) if the handler does not return a valid response, encounters an error, or times out. (For the timeout period, see Service Quotas.) If allowed, the message is delivered with returned content to all users connected to the room. If denied, the message is not delivered to any user. Default: ALLOW.
Maximum number of characters in a single message. Messages are expected to be UTF-8 encoded and this limit applies specifically to rune/code-point count, not number of bytes. Default: 500.
Maximum number of messages per second that can be sent to the room (by all clients). Default: 10.
Room name. The value does not need to be unique.

Tags to attach to the resource. Array of maps, each of the form string:string (key:value). See Tagging AWS Resources for details, including restrictions that apply to tags and "Tag naming limits and requirements"; Amazon IVS Chat has no constraints beyond what is documented there.
Identifier of the message review handler. Currently this must be an ARN of a lambda function.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.NewIVSCRoomCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Ivschat.Model.CreateRoomResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Ivschat.Model.CreateRoomResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.NewIVSCRoomCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.NewIVSCRoomCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.RemoveIVSCMessageCmdlet
member.summary: Sends an event to a specific room which directs clients to delete a specific message; that is, unrender it from view and delete it from the client’s chat history. This event’s EventName is aws:DELETE_MESSAGE. This replicates the DeleteMessage WebSocket operation in the Amazon IVS Chat Messaging API.

para.para: ID of the message to be deleted. This is the Id field in the received message (see Message (Subscribe) in the Chat Messaging API).
Reason for deleting the message.
Identifier of the room where the message should be deleted. Currently this must be an ARN.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.RemoveIVSCMessageCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Id'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Ivschat.Model.DeleteMessageResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Ivschat.Model.DeleteMessageResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.RemoveIVSCMessageCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the RoomIdentifier parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^RoomIdentifier' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.RemoveIVSCMessageCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.RemoveIVSCResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Removes tags from the resource with the specified ARN.

para.para: The ARN of the resource to be untagged. The ARN must be URL-encoded.

Array of tags to be removed. See Tagging AWS Resources for details, including restrictions that apply to tags and "Tag naming limits and requirements"; Amazon IVS Chat has no constraints beyond what is documented there.

member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Ivschat.Model.UntagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.RemoveIVSCResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.RemoveIVSCRoomCmdlet
member.summary: Deletes the specified room.

member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Ivschat.Model.DeleteRoomResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.SendIVSCEventCmdlet
member.summary: Sends an event to a room. Use this within your application’s business logic to send events to clients of a room; e.g., to notify clients to change the way the chat UI is rendered.

para.para: Application-defined metadata to attach to the event sent to clients. The maximum length of the metadata is 1 KB total.
Application-defined name of the event to send to clients.
Identifier of the room to which the event will be sent. Currently this must be an ARN.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.SendIVSCEventCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Id'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Ivschat.Model.SendEventResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Ivschat.Model.SendEventResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.SendIVSCEventCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the RoomIdentifier parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^RoomIdentifier' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.SendIVSCEventCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.UpdateIVSCRoomCmdlet
member.summary: Updates a room’s configuration.

para.para: Specifies the fallback behavior (whether the message is allowed or denied) if the handler does not return a valid response, encounters an error, or times out. (For the timeout period, see Service Quotas.) If allowed, the message is delivered with returned content to all users connected to the room. If denied, the message is not delivered to any user. Default: ALLOW.
Identifier of the room to be updated. Currently this must be an ARN.
The maximum number of characters in a single message. Messages are expected to be UTF-8 encoded and this limit applies specifically to rune/code-point count, not number of bytes. Default: 500.
Maximum number of messages per second that can be sent to the room (by all clients). Default: 10.
Room name. The value does not need to be unique.
Identifier of the message review handler. Currently this must be an ARN of a lambda function.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.UpdateIVSCRoomCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Ivschat.Model.UpdateRoomResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Ivschat.Model.UpdateRoomResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.IVSC.UpdateIVSCRoomCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Identifier parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Identifier' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
